title: Konami
content:
Anyone want to Identify? heh, thanks.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23839.gif)
author: toketsu

comments.content:
This resembles Tamil (p.158 in Solotype catalog published by Dover Books). The showing is incomplete, so I can't see enough letters to confirm it.   
   
I cannot find a showing of it online, mainly because Tamil is also a language, with it's own fonts.   
   
However, closer investigation shows Tamil to be a more square typeface than this. It has very similar serifs though.

I think Konami is big enough a company to afford its   
own custom-designed logo and/or corporate typeface.   
I could be wrong though.
I'm not familiar with the company, but custom was my next guess.

I'm still very interested in seeing that Tamil sample   
of yours (_IF_ you find the time to scan and post, don't   
do it just for me).

The Solotype Catalog Tamil differs from the logo image in several ways.   
I'd post a scan, but I bet Mike Y is working that up right now.   
   
Thought I'd mention, though, that Dieter Steffmann digitized the Black and   
Outline variants of Tamil under the name [Tobago Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/t/tobago.htm) (Win TT/T1 only).   
   
The Catalog shows 6 weights of Tamil, Light through Heavy, and I think   
Herr Steffmann chose the nicest and most potentially useful of them to   
digitize.

You're right Mike, except I had Novel Fonts "Tamago" which is Tamil Black, I think, so I decided not to try to scan the partial samples in the Solotype Catalog. Here is that font.   
 ![TamilSample](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23879.gif)
Obviously not the Konami font, but the serifs caught my eye. You don't win them all ;-)

Interesting stuff. Looks a little bit [Solesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=121) (and   
by extension [Tassish](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=1073948509954747&fontname=Tasse)). ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20090514071049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
My Konami connection couldn't find out herself, unfortunately -- I was hoping to pull out an obscure one, but no luck.
